body:
Follow-up to #13969 and #13991 

While taking care that some CPython-include requiring packages as noted [here](https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/13991#issuecomment-561949579) still work, we should generally simplify our `header` and include directory logic.

Let's just add by default `<prefix>/include` to the header directory list in packages. This is unix-wide default. Packages that are non-default should have to specify the `header` property.
title: Rework Include Build Environment Logic
